attributes.action: Make AQA explain the relevance of questions in biology gcse unit 1 exam.
attributes.additional_details: Please see the out cry on twitter and in the press for more information
attributes.background: The questions in this paper did not cover the material students were to revise and were more relevant to business studies.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition because the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for the issue you raise.  Exam boards are independent of Government and Parliament. They are regulated by the Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation (Ofqual), which regulates qualifications, examinations and assessments in England.

You can make a complaint to Ofqual about the organisations it regulates, including complaining about grade boundaries set by individual exam boards. Further information about how to complain is available here: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ofqual/about/complaints-procedure.
